Kristina Kaplan, a daughter of Lena and Gilbert Kaplan of New York, was married yesterday to Jeremy Landes Wallison, a son of Frieda and Peter Wallison of Snowmass, Colo. Deborah Kooperstein, a town justice in Southampton, N.Y., officiated in Sagaponack, N.Y.
The couple graduated from Harvard, the bride magna cum laude and the bridegroom cum laude.

The bride, 27, received an M.B.A. in May from Columbia University. Next month she is to become an associate in the communications, media and technology group at Booz Allen & Hamilton, the consulting firm, in New York. Her father is the former publisher of Institutional Investor magazine in New York, which he sold. He sits on the boards of Carnegie Hall and WNYC and is the chairman of the Kaplan Foundation, which publishes research on the music of Gustav Mahler. Her mother owns White on White, a home design store in New York.

The bridegroom, 28, received a law degree from New York University and is an associate at O'Sullivan Graev & Karabell, a New York law firm. His father, a former counsel to Vice President Nelson A. Rockefeller and to President Reagan, retired as a partner in the law firm of Gibson, Dunn & Crutcher, working in its New York and Washington offices. He is now a resident fellow at the American Enterprise Institute, a research and policy group in Washington. The bridegroom's mother, who retired as a partner in New York and Washington at the law firm of Jones, Day, Reavis & Pogue, is now the managing partner in Caddis Fly Partners, a real estate development firm in Snowmass.
